snippets.title: firestore BulkDeleteDocuments Sample
snippets.description:
BulkDeleteDocuments bulk deletes a subset of documents from Google Cloud Firestore.
Documents created or updated after the underlying system starts to process
the request will not be deleted. The bulk delete occurs in the background
and its progress can be monitored and managed via the Operation resource
that is created.

For more details on bulk delete behavior, refer to: 
https: //cloud.google.com/firestore/docs/manage-data/bulk-delete

snippets.title: firestore CancelOperation Sample
snippets.description: CancelOperation is a utility method from google.longrunning.Operations.

snippets.title: firestore CloneDatabase Sample
snippets.description:
CloneDatabase creates a new database by cloning an existing one.

The new database must be in the same cloud region or multi-region location
as the existing database. This behaves similar to
[FirestoreAdmin.CreateDatabase][google.firestore.admin.v1.FirestoreAdmin.CreateDatabase]
except instead of creating a new empty database, a new database is created
with the database type, index configuration, and documents from an existing
database.

The [long-running operation][google.longrunning.Operation] can be used to
track the progress of the clone, with the Operation's
[metadata][google.longrunning.Operation.metadata] field type being the
[CloneDatabaseMetadata][google.firestore.admin.v1.CloneDatabaseMetadata].
The [response][google.longrunning.Operation.response] type is the
[Database][google.firestore.admin.v1.Database] if the clone was
successful. The new database is not readable or writeable until the LRO has
completed.

snippets.title: firestore CreateBackupSchedule Sample
snippets.description:
CreateBackupSchedule creates a backup schedule on a database.
At most two backup schedules can be configured on a database, one daily
backup schedule and one weekly backup schedule.

snippets.title: firestore CreateDatabase Sample
snippets.description: CreateDatabase create a database.

snippets.title: firestore CreateIndex Sample
snippets.description:
CreateIndex creates a composite index. This returns a
[google.longrunning.Operation][google.longrunning.Operation] which may be
used to track the status of the creation. The metadata for the operation
will be the type
[IndexOperationMetadata][google.firestore.admin.v1.IndexOperationMetadata].

snippets.title: firestore CreateUserCreds Sample
snippets.description: CreateUserCreds create a user creds.

snippets.title: firestore DeleteBackup Sample
snippets.description: DeleteBackup deletes a backup.

snippets.title: firestore DeleteBackupSchedule Sample
snippets.description: DeleteBackupSchedule deletes a backup schedule.

snippets.title: firestore DeleteDatabase Sample
snippets.description: DeleteDatabase deletes a database.

snippets.title: firestore DeleteIndex Sample
snippets.description: DeleteIndex deletes a composite index.

snippets.title: firestore DeleteOperation Sample
snippets.description: DeleteOperation is a utility method from google.longrunning.Operations.

snippets.title: firestore DeleteUserCreds Sample
snippets.description: DeleteUserCreds deletes a user creds.

snippets.title: firestore DisableUserCreds Sample
snippets.description: DisableUserCreds disables a user creds. No-op if the user creds are already disabled.

snippets.title: firestore EnableUserCreds Sample
snippets.description: EnableUserCreds enables a user creds. No-op if the user creds are already enabled.

snippets.title: firestore ExportDocuments Sample
snippets.description:
ExportDocuments exports a copy of all or a subset of documents from Google Cloud Firestore
to another storage system, such as Google Cloud Storage. Recent updates to
documents may not be reflected in the export. The export occurs in the
background and its progress can be monitored and managed via the
Operation resource that is created. The output of an export may only be
used once the associated operation is done. If an export operation is
cancelled before completion it may leave partial data behind in Google
Cloud Storage.

For more details on export behavior and output format, refer to: 
https: //cloud.google.com/firestore/docs/manage-data/export-import

snippets.title: firestore GetBackup Sample
snippets.description: GetBackup gets information about a backup.

snippets.title: firestore GetBackupSchedule Sample
snippets.description: GetBackupSchedule gets information about a backup schedule.

snippets.title: firestore GetDatabase Sample
snippets.description: GetDatabase gets information about a database.

snippets.title: firestore GetField Sample
snippets.description: GetField gets the metadata and configuration for a Field.

snippets.title: firestore GetIndex Sample
snippets.description: GetIndex gets a composite index.

snippets.title: firestore GetOperation Sample
snippets.description: GetOperation is a utility method from google.longrunning.Operations.

snippets.title: firestore GetUserCreds Sample
snippets.description:
GetUserCreds gets a user creds resource. Note that the returned resource does not
contain the secret value itself.

snippets.title: firestore ImportDocuments Sample
snippets.description:
ImportDocuments imports documents into Google Cloud Firestore. Existing documents with the
same name are overwritten. The import occurs in the background and its
progress can be monitored and managed via the Operation resource that is
created. If an ImportDocuments operation is cancelled, it is possible
that a subset of the data has already been imported to Cloud Firestore.

snippets.title: firestore ListBackupSchedules Sample
snippets.description: ListBackupSchedules list backup schedules.

snippets.title: firestore ListBackups Sample
snippets.description: ListBackups lists all the backups.

snippets.title: firestore ListDatabases Sample
snippets.description: ListDatabases list all the databases in the project.

snippets.title: firestore ListFields Sample
snippets.description:
ListFields lists the field configuration and metadata for this database.

Currently,
[FirestoreAdmin.ListFields][google.firestore.admin.v1.FirestoreAdmin.ListFields]
only supports listing fields that have been explicitly overridden. To issue
this query, call
[FirestoreAdmin.ListFields][google.firestore.admin.v1.FirestoreAdmin.ListFields]
with the filter set to `indexConfig.usesAncestorConfig: false` or
`ttlConfig: *`.

snippets.title: firestore ListIndexes Sample
snippets.description: ListIndexes lists composite indexes.

snippets.title: firestore ListOperations Sample
snippets.description: ListOperations is a utility method from google.longrunning.Operations.

snippets.title: firestore ListUserCreds Sample
snippets.description:
ListUserCreds list all user creds in the database. Note that the returned resource
does not contain the secret value itself.

snippets.title: firestore ResetUserPassword Sample
snippets.description: ResetUserPassword resets the password of a user creds.

snippets.title: firestore RestoreDatabase Sample
snippets.description:
RestoreDatabase creates a new database by restoring from an existing backup.

The new database must be in the same cloud region or multi-region location
as the existing backup. This behaves similar to
[FirestoreAdmin.CreateDatabase][google.firestore.admin.v1.FirestoreAdmin.CreateDatabase]
except instead of creating a new empty database, a new database is created
with the database type, index configuration, and documents from an existing
backup.

The [long-running operation][google.longrunning.Operation] can be used to
track the progress of the restore, with the Operation's
[metadata][google.longrunning.Operation.metadata] field type being the
[RestoreDatabaseMetadata][google.firestore.admin.v1.RestoreDatabaseMetadata].
The [response][google.longrunning.Operation.response] type is the
[Database][google.firestore.admin.v1.Database] if the restore was
successful. The new database is not readable or writeable until the LRO has
completed.

snippets.title: firestore UpdateBackupSchedule Sample
snippets.description: UpdateBackupSchedule updates a backup schedule.

snippets.title: firestore UpdateDatabase Sample
snippets.description: UpdateDatabase updates a database.

snippets.title: firestore UpdateField Sample
snippets.description:
UpdateField updates a field configuration. Currently, field updates apply only to
single field index configuration. However, calls to
[FirestoreAdmin.UpdateField][google.firestore.admin.v1.FirestoreAdmin.UpdateField]
should provide a field mask to avoid changing any configuration that the
caller isn't aware of. The field mask should be specified as: `{ paths: 
"index_config" }`.

This call returns a
[google.longrunning.Operation][google.longrunning.Operation] which may be
used to track the status of the field update. The metadata for the
operation will be the type
[FieldOperationMetadata][google.firestore.admin.v1.FieldOperationMetadata].

To configure the default field settings for the database, use
the special `Field` with resource name: 
`projects/{project_id}/databases/{database_id}/collectionGroups/__default__/fields/*`.
